meanings.definition: Move or cause to move up and down or from side to side with small rapid movements.
meanings.sent1: The jelly on the plate was jiggling as the child giggled.
meanings.sent2: She was jiggling the keys in her hand nervously.
meanings.sent3: The jiggling pudding made everyone at the table laugh.
meanings.sent4: The jiggling leaves on the tree danced in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The jiggling of the car on the bumpy road was uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Shake slightly up and down or from side to side.
meanings.sent1: The loose tooth was jiggling whenever he talked.
meanings.sent2: She was jiggling the doorknob to see if it was locked.
meanings.sent3: The jiggling of the phone in her pocket startled her.
meanings.sent4: The jiggling of the coins in the jar sounded like music.
meanings.sent5: The jiggling of the table made the cups clink together.
